name: MDMA
json:
{
  "name": "MDMA",
  "schedule": "2",
  "category": "Stimulants",
  "description": "3,4-methylenedioxy-methamphetamine (MDMA) is a synthetic drug that alters mood and perception (awareness of surrounding objects and conditions). It is chemically similar to both stimulants and hallucinogens, producing feelings of increased energy, pleasure, emotional warmth, and distorted sensory and time perception.",
  "source": "https://psychonautwiki.org/wiki/Mdma",
  "effectsDesc": "MDMA's effects last about 3 to 6 hours, although many users take a second dose as the effects of the first dose begin to fade.",
  "effects": [
    "stimulation and energy",
    "euphoric tingling sensation that encompasses the entire body",
    "feelings of love, empathy, openness and a pronounced sense of rejuvenation and euphoria"
  ],
  "negativeEffects": [
    "increased heart rate",
    "increased blood pressure",
    "dehydration",
    "nausea"
  ],
  "safetyTips": [
    "don't mix with alcohol",
    "stay well hydrated",
    "keep yourself cool to avoid overheating"
  ],
  "streetNames": ["Molly", "Mandy", "Emma", "Ecstasy", "XTC"],
  "dosage": {
    "unit": "mg",
    "threshold": "25-45",
    "light": "45-75",
    "common": "75-140",
    "strong": "140-180"
  },
  "risks": [
    "seizure",
    "heat-stroke due to raised body temperature",
    "valvulopathy (heart valve damage)",
    "moderately addictive"
  ],
  "imageMain": "mdma.png",
  "imageCompound": "mdma.svg",
  "youtube": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/N8uB8IuP6Ps"
}

name: Hash
json:
{
  "name": "Hash",
  "schedule": "1",
  "category": "Cannabis",
  "description": "Consists of resin (the dried plant juice), which is pressed together with plant parts and binder. Hash is found in lumps or plates, and the color can be black, brown, red, or green. Hash contains an average of 6-8% THC.",
  "source": "https://psychonautwiki.org/wiki/Hashish",
  "effectsDesc": "Some short-term effects of smoking hashish are memory problems, learning problems, hard time keeping concentration, hallucinations, and high heart rate and blood pressure. These effects can take place within minutes of smoking hashish and can last for several hours.",
  "effects": [
    "spontaneous bodily sensations",
    "appetite enhancement",
    "changes in felt gravity"
  ],
  "negativeEffects": [
    "lethargy, difficulty concentrating",
    "paranoia",
    "dehydration",
    "anxiety"
  ],
  "safetyTips": [
    "keep calm and eat somenthing sweet",
    "move to a safe and relaxing location",
    "avoid alcohol, which can exacerbate the experience"
  ],
  "streetNames": ["hash", "weed", "Skunk", "grass", "herb", "ganja"],
  "dosage": {
    "unit": "mg",
    "threshold": "25",
    "light": "33 - 66",
    "common": "66 - 100",
    "strong": "100 - 150"
  },
  "risks": ["memory suppression", "paranoia", "psychosis"],
  "imageMain": "hash.png",
  "imageCompound": "thc.svg",
  "youtube": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ohbx8DAG5W8"
}

name: Fentanyl
json:
{
  "name": "Fentanyl",
  "schedule": "2",
  "category": "Opioids",
  "description": " Fentanyl is a potent opioid substance of the piperidine class. It is a strong agonist at the μ-opioid receptors and approximately 40 to 50 times more potent than pharmaceutical grade (i.e. 100% pure) heroin and roughly 80 to 100 times more potent than morphine",
  "source": "https://psychonautwiki.org/wiki/Fentanyl",
  "effectsDesc": "Like heroin, morphine, and other opioid drugs, fentanyl works by binding to the body's opioid receptors, which are found in areas of the brain that control pain and emotions. After taking opioids many times, the brain adapts to the drug, diminishing its sensitivity, making it hard to feel pleasure from anything besides the drug",
  "effects": [
    "sedation",
    "pain relief",
    "physical euphoria",
    "cognitive euphoria",
    "anxiety suppression"
  ],
  "negativeEffects": [
    "drowsiness",
    "nausea",
    "constipation",
    "sedation",
    "problems breathing",
    "itchiness"
  ],
  "safetyTips": [
    "don't consume with depressants such as opiates, benzodiazepines, barbiturates, gabapentinoids, thienodiazepines, alcohol or other GABAergic substances",
    "wear gloves while handling",
    "the amount has to be carefully measured before use, never make a rough guess of the weight"
  ],
  "streetNames": [
    "Sublimaze",
    "Actiq",
    "Duragesic",
    "Fentora",
    "Matrifen",
    "Haldid",
    "Onsolis"
  ],
  "dosage": {
    "unit": "μg",
    "threshold": "5-12",
    "light": "12-25",
    "common": "25-50",
    "strong": "50-100"
  },
  "risks": [
    "overdose",
    "potentially fatal at heavy dosage",
    "nausea and vomiting",
    "moderately addictive"
  ],
  "imageMain": "fentanyl.png",
  "imageCompound": "fentanyl.svg",
  "youtube": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/C0tW8FWBm1g"
}

name: Marijuana
json:
{
  "name": "Marijuana",
  "schedule": "1",
  "category": "Cannabis",
  "description": "Known as Marijuana (dried plant parts) is a preparation of the cannabis plant that produces psychoactive effects when consumed (via smoking, vaporizing, or ingestion). The main psychoactive components of cannabis are tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) and cannabidiol (CBD). At least three species are recognized: Cannabis sativa, Cannabis indica, and Cannabis ruderalis.",
  "source": "https://psychonautwiki.org/wiki/Marihuana",
  "effectsDesc": "When a person smokes marijuana, THC quickly passes from the lungs into the bloodstream. The blood carries the chemical to the brain and other organs throughout the body. The body absorbs THC more slowly when the person eats or drinks it. In that case, they generally feel the effects after 30 minutes to 1 hour.",
  "effects": [
    "spontaneous bodily sensations",
    "appetite enhancement",
    "changes in felt gravity"
  ],
  "negativeEffects": ["time distortion", "dehydration", "paranoia", "anxiety"],
  "safetyTips": [
    "keep calm and drink plenty of water",
    "move to a safe and relaxing location",
    "avoid alcohol, which can exacerbate the experience",
    "breathe and remember that the experience will pass"
  ],
  "streetNames": ["Marihuana", "Weed", "Pot", "Grass", "Herb", "Ganja"],
  "dosage": {
    "unit": "mg",
    "threshold": "25",
    "light": "33 - 66",
    "common": "66 - 100",
    "strong": "100 - 150"
  },
  "risks": ["memory suppression", "paranoia", "psychosis"],
  "imageMain": "weed.png",
  "imageCompound": "thc.svg",
  "youtube": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/kD24KRvHwQk"
}

name: LSD
json:
{
  "name": "LSD",
  "schedule": "2",
  "category": "Psychedelics",
  "description": "LSD (D-lysergic acid diethylamide) is one of the most powerful mind-altering chemicals. It is a clear or white odorless material made from lysergic acid, which is found in a fungus that grows on rye and other grains.",
  "source": "https://psychonautwiki.org/wiki/Lsd",
  "effectsDesc": "The subjective effects of LSD can be broken down into several components which progressively intensify proportional to dosage in a nonlinear manner. In comparison to other psychedelics such as psilocybin mushrooms, LSA and ayahuasca, LSD is significantly more stimulating and fast-paced in both its physical and cognitive effects and produces a wide variety of effects that can potentially be attributed to its binding activity at a range of CNS receptors other than serotonin, such as those of dopamine and norepinephrine.",
  "effects": [
    "analysis enhancement - LSD is commonly reported to give the user the ability to analyze situations in a novel and beneficial way.",
    "colour enhancement - in comparison to other psychedelics, this effect is often reported to be brighter and more \"radiant\" in its character.",
    "creativity enhancement - LSD is well-known for its ability to enhance creativity and out-of-the-box thinking.",
    "emotion enhancement - LSD strongly enhances the user's ability to experience emotion",
    "spirituality enhancement, auditory enhancement, existential self-realization, unity and interconnectedness, increased sense of humor and much more..."
  ],
  "negativeEffects": [
    "mild nausea",
    "appetite supression",
    "time distortion",
    "dehydration",
    "paranoia"
  ],
  "safetyTips": [
    "avoid unfamiliar or hazardous territory (heights/traffic)",
    "stay hydrated",
    "don't be on your own, have someone you know looking after you",
    "don't combine with other drugs",
    "test your LSD",
    "be in a good mood before use"
  ],
  "streetNames": ["LSD-25", "Lucy", "L", "Acid", "Cid", "Tabs", "Blotter"],
  "dosage": {
    "unit": "µg",
    "threshold": "15",
    "light": "25 - 75",
    "common": "75 - 150",
    "strong": "150 - 300"
  },
  "risks": [
    "psychological trauma",
    "may trigger or exacerbate symptoms (e.g. delusions, mania, psychosis) in those who have or are predisposed to mental illness such as bipolar disorder or schizophrenia",
    "poisioning due to ingesting different (mimic) substance than LSD such as 25x-NBOMe and DOx",
    "pshysical harm due to impaired judgement"
  ],
  "imageMain": "lsd.png",
  "imageCompound": "lsd.svg",
  "youtube": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/bHOVZ_Tb3ik"
}

name: Mushrooms
json:
{
  "name": "Mushrooms",
  "schedule": "2",
  "category": "Psychedelics",
  "description": "Psilocybin mushrooms are a family of psychoactive mushrooms that contain the psychedelic tryptamine psilocybin. Psilocybin mushrooms occur on all continents and have been taxonomically classified into over 200 species, the most potent of which belong to the genus Psilocybe.",
  "source": "https://psychonautwiki.org/wiki/Mushrooms",
  "effectsDesc": "Like other psychedelics, psilocybin mushrooms produce their effects by acting on serotonin receptors in the brain. The hallucinogenic effects of psilocybin usually occur within 30 minutes of ingestion and last between 4 and 6 hours.",
  "effects": [
    "analysis enhancement -  this effect is consistent in its manifestation and outrospection dominant",
    "colour enhancement - relative to other psychedelics, this effect may appear to be more saturated",
    "empathy, affection, and sociability enhancement",
    "emotion enhancement - this effect can be described as being more prominent, consistent and profound when compared to other traditional psychedelics such as mescaline or LSD",
    "spirituality enhancement, auditory enhancement, existential self-realization, unity and interconnectedness and much more..."
  ],
  "negativeEffects": [
    "nausea",
    "delusion",
    "runny nose",
    "watery eyes",
    "muscle contractions"
  ],
  "safetyTips": [
    "avoid unfamiliar or hazardous territory (heights/traffic)",
    "stay hydrated",
    "don't be on your own, have someone you know looking after you",
    "don't combine with other drugs",
    "test your mushrooms",
    "be in a good mood before use"
  ],
  "streetNames": ["Magic mushrooms", "Psychedelic mushrooms", "Shrooms"],
  "dosage": {
    "unit": "g",
    "threshold": "0.25 - 0.5",
    "light": "0.5 - 1",
    "common": "1 - 2.5",
    "strong": "2.5 - 5"
  },
  "risks": [
    "psychological trauma",
    "may trigger or exacerbate symptoms (e.g. delusions, mania, psychosis) in those who have or are predisposed to mental illness such as bipolar disorder or schizophrenia",
    "poisioning due to ingesting a different species of mushroom which can be lethal"
  ],
  "imageMain": "mushroom.png",
  "imageCompound": "psilocybin.svg",
  "youtube": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/E7T1BbnFxpM"
}

name: Cocaine
json:
{
  "name": "Cocaine",
  "schedule": "2",
  "category": "Stimulants",
  "description": " Cocaine is extracted from the leaves of the coca plant. The plant originates from South America, and the South American indigenous chewed coca leaves, among other things, to counteract fatigue and altitude sickness. There are several types of cocaine, such as 'crack' and 'freebase'. During manufacture, various chemicals are used.",
  "source": "https://psychonautwiki.org/wiki/Cocaine",
  "effectsDesc": "Cocaine produces a short, intense intoxication, reminiscent of amphetamine intoxication that takes about 30 minutes.",
  "effects": [
    "extremely energetic and stimulating",
    "no feelings of fatigue",
    "focus enhancement - this component is most effective at low to moderate dosages as anything higher will usually impair concentration",
    "motivation enhancement, increased libido, increased music appreciation"
  ],
  "negativeEffects": [
    "irritability and depression after comedown",
    "anxiety and tension",
    "supresses apetite",
    "abnormal heartbeat"
  ],
  "safetyTips": [
    "don't mix with other substances",
    "avoid if you have a known heart condition or family history of heart conditions"
  ],
  "streetNames": ["Coke", "White", "Blow", "Snow"],
  "dosage": {
    "unit": "mg",
    "threshold": "5",
    "light": "10 - 30",
    "common": "30 - 60",
    "strong": "60 - 90"
  },
  "risks": [
    "overdose",
    "heart problems, such as cardiac arrest that can be fatal",
    "sniffing cocaine can cause nosebleeds and eventually destroy the mucous membranes of the nose",
    "highly adictive"
  ],
  "imageMain": "cocaine.png",
  "imageCompound": "cocaine.svg",
  "youtube": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/9pNs3kNBfu0"
}
